An '''End island''' is a [[terrain feature]] made up of a roughly hemispherical cluster of [[End stone]] blocks found within its respective biome.

== Generation ==
End island features are generated from Y=55 to Y=70 around the [[Terrain features#Outer islands|outer islands]]. The probability that an End island tries to generate in each chunk is {{frac|1|14}}. It generates successfully when in a [[small End islands]] biome{{only|java}} or at a chunk where the noise value fits{{only|bedrock}}. {{IN|Java}}, if it tries to generate a small island in a chunk, there's an {{frac|1|4}} probability to try to generate another small island in this chunk. The two islands often overlap with each other. {{IN|Bedrock}}, if the chunk's noise value fits, there's also a probability of {{frac|1|4}} to re-generate another island, but at the same position, which makes the two islands look like a single island. 

End island features also generate when an [[End gateway]] spawns on the outer islands if the chunk does not provide any [[End stone]].
